verses.text: And when the seventh month was come , and the children of Israel \add were\add* in the cities , the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.

Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak , and his brethren the priests , and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel , and his brethren , and builded the altar of the God of Israel , to offer burnt offerings thereon, as \add it is\add* written in the law of Moses the man of God.\f + \fr 3.2 \ft Jeshua: also called, Joshua\f*\f + \fr 3.2 \ft Zerubbabel: Gr. Zorobabel\f*\f + \fr 3.2 \ft Shealtiel: Gr. Salathiel\f*

And they set the altar upon his bases ; for fear \add was\add* upon them because of the people of those countries : and they offered burnt offerings thereon unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add even\add* burnt offerings morning and evening.

They kept also the feast of tabernacles , as \add it is\add* written , and \add offered\add* the daily burnt offerings by number , according to the custom , as the duty of every day required ;\f + \fr 3.4 \ft as the duty…: Heb. the matter of the day in his day\f*

And afterward \add offered\add* the continual burnt offering , both of the new moons , and of all the set feasts of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that were consecrated , and of every one that willingly offered a freewill offering unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. But the foundation of the temple of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was not \add yet\add* laid.  +  r 3.6  t the foundation…: Heb. the temple of the \+nd LORD\+nd* was not yet founded *

They gave money also unto the masons , and to the carpenters ; and meat , and drink , and oil , unto them of Zidon , and to them of Tyre , to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa , according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.\f + \fr 3.7 \ft carpenters: or, workmen\f* \p

¶ Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God at Jerusalem , in the second month , began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel , and Jeshua the son of Jozadak , and the remnant of their brethren the priests and the Levites , and all they that were come out of the captivity unto Jerusalem ; and appointed the Levites , from twenty years old and upward , to set forward the work of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Then stood Jeshua \add with\add* his sons and his brethren , Kadmiel and his sons , the sons of Judah , together , to set forward the workmen in the house of God : the sons of Henadad , \add with\add* their sons and their brethren the Levites.\f + \fr 3.9 \ft Judah: also called, Hodaviah\f*\f + \fr 3.9 \ft together: Heb. as one\f*

And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets , and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals , to praise the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, after the ordinance of David king of Israel.

And they sang together by course in praising and giving thanks unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; because \add he is\add* good , for his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever toward Israel. And all the people shouted with a great shout , when they praised the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, because the foundation of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was laid.

But many of the priests and Levites and chief of the fathers , \add who were\add* ancient men , that had seen the first house , when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes , wept with a loud voice ; and many shouted aloud for joy :
So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people : for the people shouted with a loud shout , and the noise was heard afar off.
